intro: Anisodus acutangulus, commonly known as the Chinese horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers with prominent yellow stamens. The plant has a short, upright stem with smooth, lance-shaped leaves. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, oval seeds. Anisodus acutangulus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in Chinese medicine.
